title: How to Set Up Google Alerts: Tips and Tricks
description: Learn how to set up Google Alerts without any hassle in several clicks. Use our tips on advanced Google search operators to get the most relevant results.
content: Blog / Analytics & Reporting / The ultimate guide on how to set up Google AlertsThe ultimate guide on how to set up Google Alerts Written by Yulia Deda Aug 29, 2024 5 min read Key takeaways Google Alerts is a free service that sends email notifications for new content matching your search terms. With Google Alerts, you can discover emerging industry trends, monitor competitors, identify content gaps for your own website, and stay updated on relevant news. To set up Google Alerts, you need to create a Google account (or use your existing one), go to the dedicated Google Alerts page, enter your search terms, and customize settings. Google allows you to refine your alerts by setting frequency, source, language, region, and result volume (all vs. best results only). To refine the results even further, you can use search operators (e.g., quotation marks for finding an exact phrase match, the “site” operator for searching within a particular website, the minus sign for excluding searches containing specific search terms, etc.). You have the opportunity to edit or delete alerts directly from the Google Alerts webpage or notification emails. How Google Alerts can help your business Google Alerts is a free service from Google that allows you to receive email updates whenever new content that matches your specified search terms appears on the web. Setting up Google Alerts can help you: 1. Keep tabs on the latest news and developments in your areas of interest. For instance, you can monitor content around keywords like “niche marketing,” “brand positioning,” or “AI for increased productivity” to stay on top of industry developments. 2. Monitor competitors’ activities and strategies. In particular, you can track their press releases and blog posts to understand their marketing initiatives, product launches, and customer engagement strategies. 3. Identify emerging trends in your industry. These can be alerts for terms like “sustainability in fashion,” “e-commerce trends,” and so on. 4. Find relevant articles, blog posts, and other content related to your interests. These might help you get inspired with new topics, improve your knowledge within a particular niche, or identify the main content gaps for your own website. To learn more about how to use Google Alerts for marketing, make sure to read this guide. Simple ways to manage Google Alerts Setting up Google Alerts is easier than you can imagine. All you need to do is create a Gmail account or log into an existing one and follow further instructions. Creating alerts Whether you set up Google Alerts for company names, competitors, or any news, the process is the same. 1. Go to https://www.google.com/alerts and type in your search terms. 2. Click the Show Options button below the search box to apply the most suitable settings for you. 3. By going through the list of variables, you will be able to customize alerts features, such as: How often: Receive notifications for your search query once a day, once a week, or as it happens. Sources: Either ask for notifications from all sources or customize to receive alerts from blogs, books, videos, etc. Language: Select a certain language or receive notifications in all languages. Region: Choose a region or specific country that you want to analyze. How many: Select the search results’ frequency by applying the “only the best results” or “all the results” option. The “all results” filter is designed to notify users about each found item across the web, whereas the “only the best results” option only generates the most relevant search results. Deliver to: Specify whether you want your alerts delivered to your email address or an RSS feed. This is when Google Alerts shows a preview of your future notifications, so you can make sure you’ve set all settings up correctly. 4. Click the Create Alert button. Editing alerts To edit or change Google Alerts, you will need to stick to the steps listed below: 1. Go to Google Alerts. 2. Click the pencil icon next to the alert you created. 3. Make your changes with your search term or filters. 4. Hit the Update Alert button. Alternatively, you can edit a Google Alert by opening the notification email and clicking the Edit this alert button. Once you are directed to https://www.google.com/alerts, go through the same steps as above. Deleting alerts If you’re wondering how to stop Google Alerts, there are two ways you can do it. They are as follows: 1. Go to your Google Alerts page and click the trashcan icon next to an alert. 2. Open one of the Google Alert notification emails and press the Unsubscribe button. You will then be redirected to your Google Alerts page to confirm your decision. Useful operators When setting Google Alerts, you can take advantage of search operators that significantly narrow and refine the results. For example: With the help of the site: operator, you can search within a particular website. For example, type site:ikea.com sofa if you want to limit your search to the pages of the IKEA website. Put the keyword inside quotation marks if you want to look for an exact phrase. For instance, search for “ikea desks” if you want to receive the exact match. Setting a Google Alert with the dash or minus sign – in the front of a certain keyword can help you exclude searches containing this term. For example, you can type ikea home decor -candles if you don’t want to receive results containing the “candles” keyword while searching online. Additional settings By clicking the settings cog near the My Alerts section, you can also set the time of day that you want to receive notifications and whether to send every alert separately into a single email. Simply hit the checkbox next to Delivery Time and then choose a time to receive the alert. Next, to determine the frequency each alert will be sent to your inbox, click the checkbox next to Digest. Finally, press the Save button to close Google Alert settings. By the way, don’t miss a chance to get acquainted with other Google tools that can help you grow a successful business. Here are our separate guides on how to set up Google Search Console and Google Analytics 4. Final thoughts Google Alerts is a straightforward yet powerful tool that can be tailored to support your main topics of interest on the Internet. By setting it up correctly, Google Alerts can deliver key data and important mentions directly to your inbox, helping you stay on top of the things that matter most for your marketing and SEO goals.
